record.darwin:Remarks: The fin clips are from specimens that were Pit tagged and released. The corresponding Pit tag numbers are: 0A00075326, male, 305 mm SL, 354 mm TL, 300 g, no visible signs of condition; 0A00077842, male, 371 mm SL, 425 mm TL, 750 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00080129, male, 392 mm SL, 451 mm TL, 850 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00082853, male, 361 mm SL, 413 mm TL, 660 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00084543, male, 337 mm SL, 382 mm TL, 580 g, tubercles developed, ripe and running; 0A00084550, female, 348 mm SL, 411 mm TL, 1100 g, no loss of mucus, gravid; 0A00084644, female, 290 mm SL, 335 mm TL, 330 g, no visible signs of condition; 0A00087726, male, 346 mm SL, 399 mm TL, 600 g, tubercles developing, not running. The specimen labelled 200404111 was not pit tagged - it was a female, 419 mm SL, 486 mm TL, 1100 g, no loss of mucus, gravid. The dry specimens are scales and both the scales and the fin clips are separated within the bag/jar by their ID numbers which are the last 5 digits of the Pit tag number.

record.darwin:Remarks: Dorsal rays V, 9; Anal rays= I, 11 or 12; P1=13-14; P2s united 6-7 rays each; scales large, many missing but probably ca.21-23 in lateral series; tongue strongly bilobed; upper jaw appears to have multiple teeth rows, lower singular; jaws very oblique; corresponds well to characters given in Smith (1945) - Wayne C. Starnes, 2006.
